intro: Bubbia muelleri, commonly known as the Mueller's burr, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny fruits. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are small and white or greenish in color. Bubbia muelleri is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
